factoid: Prince Vasíli passed by, seeming not to hear the ladies, and sat down on a sofa in a far corner of the room.
Prince Vasíli closed his eyes and seemed to be dozing.
Prince Vasíli's head sank forward and then Prince Vasíli roused himself.
Prince Vasíli said to Princess Aline, "Aline, go and see what the ladies are about."
Princess Aline went up to the door, passed by the door with a dignified and indifferent air, and glanced into the little drawing room.
Pierre and Hélène still sat talking just as before.
Princess Aline said to Pierre, "Still the same."
Prince Vasíli frowned, twisting his mouth, his cheeks quivered and Prince Vasíli's face assumed the coarse, unpleasant expression peculiar to him.
Prince Vasíli shook himself, rose, threw back his head, and with resolute steps went past the ladies into the little drawing room.
Prince Vasíli went joyfully up to Pierre.
Prince Vasíli's face was unusually triumphant, causing Pierre to rise in alarm on seeing it.
Prince Vasíli said, "Thank God!"
Prince Vasíli said, "Princess Aline has told me everything!"
Prince Vasíli put one arm around Pierre and the other around Lëlya.
Prince Vasíli said, "My dear boy… Lëlya… I am very pleased."
Prince Vasíli's voice trembled.
Prince Vasíli said, "I loved Pierre’s father… and Princess Aline will make Lëlya a good wife… God bless you!"
Prince Vasíli embraced Lëlya.
Prince Vasíli again embraced Pierre.
Prince Vasíli kissed Pierre with his malodorous mouth.
Tears moistened Prince Vasíli's cheeks.
Prince Vasíli shouted, "Princess Aline, come here!"
Princess Aline came in and also wept.
Princess Aline used Princess Aline’s handkerchief.
Pierre was kissed, and Pierre kissed the beautiful Hélène’s hand several times.
After a while Pierre and Hélène were left alone again.
Pierre thought, "All this had to be and could not be otherwise, so it is useless to ask whether it is good or bad. It is good because it’s definite and one is rid of the old tormenting doubt."
Pierre held the hand of Hélène in silence, looking at Hélène’s beautiful bosom as it rose and fell.
Pierre said aloud, "Hélène!" and paused.
Pierre thought, "Something special is always said in such cases, but could not remember what it was that people say."
Pierre looked at Hélène’s face.
Hélène drew nearer to Pierre.
Hélène’s face flushed.
Hélène said, "Oh, take those off… those…" pointing to Prince Vasíli’s spectacles.
Pierre took off Prince Vasíli’s spectacles.
Pierre's eyes had a frightened and inquiring look after removing Prince Vasíli’s spectacles.
Pierre was about to stoop over Hélène’s hand and kiss it, but Hélène intercepted Pierre's lips and met them with her own.
Hélène’s face struck Pierre, by its altered, unpleasantly excited expression.
Pierre thought, "It is too late now, it’s done; besides I love Hélène."
Pierre said, "Je vous aime!" remembering what has to be said at such moments, but Pierre’s words sounded so weak that Pierre felt ashamed of himself.
Pierre said, "I love you."

Six weeks later Prince Vasíli was married, and settled in Count Bezúkhov’s large, newly furnished Petersburg house, the happy possessor, as people said, of a wife who was a celebrated beauty and of millions of money.
Old Prince Nicholas Bolkónski received a letter from Prince Vasíli in November 1805, announcing that Prince Vasíli and Prince Vasíli's son Anatole would be paying Prince Nicholas Bolkónski a visit.

Prince Vasíli wrote, "I am starting on a journey of inspection, and of course I shall think nothing of an extra seventy miles to come and see Prince Nicholas Bolkónski at the same time, my honored benefactor."

Prince Vasíli wrote, "My son Anatole is accompanying me on his way to the army, so I hope you will allow him personally to express the deep respect that, emulating his father, he feels for Prince Nicholas Bolkónski."
Princess Aline remarked, "It seems that there will be no need to bring Mary out, suitors are coming to us of their own accord."
Prince Nicholas Bolkónski frowned, but said nothing.
A fortnight after the letter, Prince Vasíli’s servants came one evening in advance of Prince Vasíli, and Prince Vasíli and Prince Vasíli's son Anatole arrived next day.
